title: How to Make Mini Chocolate Pecan Peanut Log Rolls

steps.headline: Mix the self-raising flour in a bowl.
steps.description: Sieve the flour to let in air. Rub in the cubed butter until it resembles breadcrumbs.

steps.headline: Make a well in the middle of the mix.
steps.description: Add the eggs, caster sugar and milk. Mix evenly, then beat.

steps.headline: Add the crushed nuts, honey and syrup.
steps.description: Mix to combine gently. It should form a smooth dough.

steps.headline: Melt the cooking chocolate.
steps.description: Place about 1/2 of the bar into a bowl suspended over a boiling pot of hot water. Allow the chocolate to melt slowly, stirring the chocolate. Don't let the chocolate burn. Once the chocolate has melted, add the 4 tablespoons of drinking chocolate, stir gently.

steps.headline: Add the squeezed orange juice to the chocolate mix.
steps.description: Stir through the chocolate sauce. Once combined, remove from the heat and let stand for 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the chocolate/orange mixture to the pastry mixture.
steps.description: Gently mix it together, making sure that the chocolate orange flavour chocolate is evenly mixed on through the pastry mix.

steps.headline: Form chocolate/orange pastry mix into a dough.
steps.description: Flour the board and rolling pin. Roll out to an even thickness. Place parchment/baking paper beneath the pastry.

steps.headline: Cover evenly with a creamy pot of caramel sauce and tinned double cream.
Form a roll.
steps.description: Use the ends of the parchment paper to tightly roll the pastry dough and hold it in a roll shape. It does not matter if pastry cracks.

steps.headline: Place in the oven to bake.
steps.description: Turn down heat to 120ºC, and bake for 20-25 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven, place on wire rack too cool.
Prepare for serving.
steps.description: When cooled, cut the log cake into equally shaped squares and dust with icing sugar.

text: Making the pastry dough Mix the self-raising flour in a bowl. Sieve the flour to let in air. Rub in the cubed butter until it resembles breadcrumbs. Make a well in the middle of the mix. Add the eggs, caster sugar and milk. Mix evenly, then beat. Add the crushed nuts, honey and syrup. Mix to combine gently. It should form a smooth dough. Making the chocolate filling Melt the cooking chocolate. Place about 1/2 of the bar into a bowl suspended over a boiling pot of hot water. Allow the chocolate to melt slowly, stirring the chocolate. Don't let the chocolate burn. Once the chocolate has melted, add the 4 tablespoons of drinking chocolate, stir gently. Add the squeezed orange juice to the chocolate mix. Stir through the chocolate sauce. Once combined, remove from the heat and let stand for 5 minutes. Making the rolls Add the chocolate/orange mixture to the pastry mixture. Gently mix it together, making sure that the chocolate orange flavour chocolate is evenly mixed on through the pastry mix. Lightly grease the baking tray.  Form chocolate/orange pastry mix into a dough. Flour the board and rolling pin. Roll out to an even thickness. Place parchment/baking paper beneath the pastry. Cover evenly with a creamy pot of caramel sauce and tinned double cream.  Form a roll. Use the ends of the parchment paper to tightly roll the pastry dough and hold it in a roll shape. It does not matter if pastry cracks. Place in the oven to bake. Turn down heat to 120ºC, and bake for 20-25 minutes. Remove from the oven, place on wire rack too cool.  Prepare for serving. When cooled, cut the log cake into equally shaped squares and dust with icing sugar. Finished.
